author: {'steamid': '76561198026132235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 6063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5717, 'last_played': 1701530659}
review:
С графической стороны все прекрасно, симпатичный пиксель арт, приятные и не напрягающие глаза картинка и спецэффекты. Целая куча вещей для крафта и выбивания из врагов. Много видов противников и приличное количество биомов.
Можно сказать что плюсы закончились, теперь минусы.
С точки зрения игровых механик здесь все плохо или вообще отвратительно, выбраны и надерганы худшие решения:
 Ультракороткие сутки, спавн сундуков и уникальных врагов привязанный ко времени суток, который происходит ЧЕТЫРЕ раза, через каждые 5 минут. Старые враги убегают из боя и пропадают, новые бегут из-за края экрана, с соседних биомов тоже бегут, набирается их пол сотни и все начинают бить друг друга, переагриваться на вас...
Постоянное желание персонажа жрать, классическое "выживание" где за 20 минут суток надо съесть 30 яблок и 10 куриц, отсутствие какой-либо регенерации здоровья, даже при высокой сытости, 
Прочность вещей невероятно низкая, ремонтировать надо каждые 5-10 минут, железные предметы менее прочные чем каменные и некоторые деревянные, и менее эффективны в добыче(серьезно?). Абсолютно бесполезные все виды брони и щитов что до брони из колоссального кабана,а это, извините предтоповый доспех. 
Большая часть врагов убьет вас 1 ударом, в колоссальной броне с 2, зато есть наипрекраснейшая механика смерти - пока у вас есть хилки вы не умрете, мммм, прям сразу видно вдохновление донт старвом и террарией,
Сумасшедшее количество ресурсов нужное для крафта, почти с самого начала, главная проблема в  том что нет гарантированного дропа. Ага, надо 50 железа? Значит нужно раскопать не 50 месторождений,а 300, нужно 125 черепов? Ооо, открой 800 сундуков, братан, решил сделать броню, значит иди убей босса 15 раз, а когда сделаешь и максимально улучшишь ее, босс и мобы с локации босса продолжат тебя 1-2 ударами убивать.
Слоты быстрого доступа, их четыре... Слава богу оружие в отдельных, двух... слотах. Есть возможность переключаться на 2 набор экипировки, куда можно сунуть еще, только вот броня тоже отдельная для наборов, впрочем, вспоминая ее эффективность, черт с этим. При столь убогой панели быстрого доступа никакой паузы при входе в инвентарь.
Дальность обзора. казалось бы, ну что можно сделать хуже, чем обзор дальностью 3 метра, но нет, можно!
Камера сдвигается в противоположную сторону, т.е. 30% экрана это та сторона в которую вы идете, врезаясь во все виды врагов которые вас уже увидели из-за края экрана и начали бить или стрелять, 70% экрана это то что находится позади персонажа, у него глаза в жопе чтоли растут?
Дальнобойное оружие рассыпается на части если вы не перезарядили его вовремя. Если вы расстреляли 11из12 стрел и взяли новую пачку, все ок, вы можете бесконечно так стрелять из лука, но стоит вам выпустить все 12, лук превращается в пыль.Дробовик и пистолет разваливаются и больше не пригодны к использованию. ?????????????????????????
Ваш персонаж не знает рецепты и не открывает их получая ресурс, рецепты с некоторым шансом выпадают с определенного врага или дерева/камня. Ну вот я "прошел" что было в игре на данный момент, почти 100 часов, я так и не получил рецепт железной кирки))
Система добычи которую я упомянул несколько раз - вы можете получить абсолютный ноль выкопав месторождение ресурса или разбив сундук. Месторождения имеют "здоровье", инструменты урон, чем больше ударов вы сделаете, тем больше ресурсов вы получите, ведь шанс выпадения рассчитывается на удар, т.е. кирка или топор из железа ломаются быстрее каменных и добывают меньше предметов.
Уфф, не знаю что я там еще забыл, наверно только битву с Королем Хемлоком, который от каждого вашего удара улетает от вас за пол биома и вы бегаете весь день за ним, оббегая тысячи спавнящахся врагов пока время не закончится и он не пропадет. 
Да и в целом эта механика с отталкиванием и персонажа и врага при ударе, все улетают на безумные расстояния, вылетают за край обзора, пропадают после этого. в пещерах можно критануть по врагу и отлететь из-за этой механики черт знает куда, упасть в дыру и умереть,ну, класс.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003416630', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1706312869}
review:
Très bonne surprise ! Coup de coeur même, pour un petit jeu à l'ambition toute simple de vous faire explorer un monde généré procéduralement (les tuiles sur la map sont comme des biomes définis par une aire rectangulaire facilement reconnaissable). Ca faisait longtemps que moi et un pote on attendait un trip comme ça. <3

Points forts :
- La DA/Le style grunge.
- Les sons, feedback quand on tape. Les onomatopés.
- La vie du jeu : les PNJ animaux/créatures qui se foutent sur la gueule, les PNJ humains qui vous aident.
- La diversité des PNJ, des sprites d'environnement (on ne s'en lasse pas). Big-up aux robots-tronçonneurs !
- Le cycle météo avec des mobs vraiment flippants la nuit.
- L'aspect "général", très vivant et donnant envie d'explorer.
- 21:9 pris en compte / windowed borderless, le pied !!

Points faibles :
- Le perso manque un peu d'animations (l'arme qui tourne sur elle-même pour indiquer qu'on tape).
- Frapper va tout le temps à la même vitesse, peu importe l'arme => ça aurait mérité des armes plus rapides (ex : poings).
- On a tout le temps la dalle, et on doit chercher de la bouffe (blé, pommes, miel). Pas le temps de regarder son stuff ni le système de craft tranquillement, c'est vraiment chiant.
- Plein d'armes sont nulles, seules une ou deux servent. On amasse des matériaux dans des coffres mais on doute de l'utilité de tout ça (quoi que bon, à voir).
- Pareil pour la bouffe : pourquoi se faire chier à crafter du pain, alors que bouffer les oeufs directement est aussi efficace ?
- Arrivé à certains endroits, plein de monstres sont assez rapidement imbattables (on se fait one-shoter). Le problème c'est quand on a fait toutes les tuiles autours du point de départ et qu'on est bloqué. On revient en arrière et on tourne en rond.
- Y'a pas de quête, pas vraiment d'enjeu (sauf l'explo). Ca aurait été bien de défendre des villages, de voir les PNJ-monstres attaquer.
- La lenteur de chargement de la partie. On dirait que ça régénère le monde à chaque fois.

Il est 2h du mat', pas le temps de peaufiner cette revue. Mais je repasserai si besoin éditer mon message.

review:
it's alright. The game isn't perfect, but it doesn't need to be. With it now being free to play I expected the game to be somewhat lesser in content, less often updated, and with more paid DLC and what not to keep it afloat, along with some kinda BS currency system like just about every free to play game out there.

I have never been happier to be wrong. The game has a lot of content, clearly has some love put into it, and isn't made to farm you for cash.

HOWEVER
The amount of one hit kill enemies when you're just starting out is atrocious
Zombies are a pain to fight, the area denial mechanic of the infectious gore is good on paper, but when there's literal hordes of these things, it's just broken. And why the heck are they so FAST? They don't do that much damage, they're like wasps that turn into piles of area denial fuckery.
What do you mean goblin bullies can spawn right outside spawn?
There needs to be fixes on enemy balancing, because the amount of times i've died in situations I honestly had no control over is just...no. 

Even despite this, I still enjoy this game, it takes a lot of effort to sink in to get good, and everything else is decent enough. For free, I can't be mad at what i got.

review:
I've played this game for quite a bit, and I can tell you: it's severely unpolished, in so many aspects, it's made unbearable to play, specially for casuals. And I would love to point out some issues that led me to say this in this review:

    First, the looting system SUCKS!: in this game, the ONLY way to "harvest" the resources you need to progress is to "attack" said objects, and with each attack, there will be a chance of a material dropping from their loot table, which also gives a huge chance of nothing dropping from a tree, well, not only that seems too simple, it gets worse, if you use strongest weapons against a resource type, unless that weapon was made to harvest it, you might get nothing, and good example of that is chests, they drop things that you absolutely need to progress, but if you ever DARE to not use your bare hands to punch one down, you might get absolutely nothing from them!
     It would be far more pleasurable if this game had ACTUAL loot systems, such as actually looting chests to collect what's inside of them, instead of punching them like a moron, or an definitive way to collect each resource, such as chopping down a tree to get a DEFINED amount of wood, instead of it just being attacking stable "enemies", oh, by the way, looting enemies work exactly the same, we can't loot an defined inventory, we have to cross our fingers to get as much as the game wants us to get. putting it simple: this game is PURE RNG, so I only wish you luck! I really wish we could get an DETERMINED amount of loot for each action, relying on random sucks really hard!

    Second, oh the Second, if that was only one of the issues, is that the UI is absolutely tiring to use, its impractical, and controlling it is a nightmare, using either of the crafting systems is an challenge, heck, it can't even use your steering well to browse in a pleasant way through your absolutely freaking massive amount of "blueprints".

    Third, This game gives a middle finger to Balance, right off the bat, you are left with unclear instructions, and a "to do list" which is as empty as the game itself is in mechanics, as I mentioned before, the loot table here is nuts, and your progress depends a lot in loot chests found uncommonly around, and they might never drop what you need.
     if you try leaving your safe zone, you're already met with enemies that can kill you in one-hit, or curse you with debuffs that instantly kills you with a single stare, this game already throws its strongest foes in your hands, and believe in me, you will NOT be ready to fend them off, you'll be as weak as an needle, thanks to the balancing system, and to this game's hideous crafting system, which I'll get into very soon. 
    oh yeah, also, if you survive till its night time, you will already meet with enemies that destroy everything, including you, in a hit, and makes those precious resources they destroy turn into dust, into nothing, because elements destroyed by monsters yield no loot.

    Fourth, the crafting system: for a game focused on adventure, it has an horrible, complicated crafting system, to craft a single, non-durable piece of armor, you need to gather around 6 different kind of ingredients, I kid you not, and those piece of armor, weaponry, and tool, BREAK! and repairing them is a nightmare, you need very specific resources made from dismantling items of the same tier and kind, it could be as simple as just gathering enough of a kind to craft something, but not, tons and tons of different materials to craft an essential tool, and good luck if you die: if you do die again, you lose them forever, the crafting system is a mistake, a terrible, terrible mistake, that would be much better if it was oversimplified: instead of having to cut that goblin skin into 6 freaking different parts, just let me craft an armor out of it, the game handles the boring part, please! this is supposed to be an adventure, not an armor-forging simulator! 
    also, it would be 1000% better if these did not break, for sake, if they are going to be hard to make, and not renewable, then please spare us from this, most adventure games have unbreakable items, why shall this one not?
    just a last quick note on this aspect, you need over complicated recipes to do even the most basic of things, such as a campfire to protect you against the one-shot monsters that wander at night (and the campfire isn't even renewable, its gone when it extinguishes!)

    This game as it currently is is a nightmare to play, I highly recommend waiting for a while until it gets more polished, as it is being actively developed, right now, it's utterly BORING to play, and I'd recommend turning back while you still can.
EDIT: this review was made for a very early version of the game, I will give it a second try now that it has been gone through dozens of updates after I stopped playing, and maybe edit or delete my review depending on how more playable it has become for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367705780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 46142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8551, 'last_played': 1578793933}
review:
Dunque, il gioco in se potrebbe anche essere carino, ma allo stato dei fatti è solo frustrante. Ho aspettato a fare un commento perchè volevo vedere se alla lunga potesse migliorare, invece peggiora e non ti porta a molti progressi.
L'alternanza giorno/notte è troppo veloce, si muore in continuazione e spesso non si riesce a recuperare lo zaino (che in pratica è un pò il focus dei progressi, se muori nel tentativo di recuperarlo è come se si dovesse reiniziare da capo), questo perchè ci sono troppi nemici e troppo forti (e che corrono e in alcuni casi più del pg, ad esempio gli zombie dove sono morto rincorso da 20 di loro che uscivano dalle tane, sono VERAMENTE TROPPI). Di notte è impossibile stare fuori, devi avere per forza una casa e dato che appunto il giorno dura molto poco, per potersi spingere più in là nella mappa si è costretti a fare un'infinità di case, alle volte morendo nel tentativo di piazzarla perchè magari il tuo pet si piazza in mezzo e cercando di trovare un'altra posizione spunta un mostro che ti ammazza. Beh, quando muori però c'è il respown................peccato che non è modificabile (o perlomeno io non sono riuscito a modificarlo), in pratica si rinasce nel punto iniziale della mappa, quindi se si riesce ad arrivare abbastanza lontano toccherà rifarsi da zero tutta la strada per arrivare quantomeno a recuperare lo zaino sperando che le creature che si incontrano strada facendo e che inizieranno a rincorrerti si attacchino tra loro dandoti almeno la speranza di arrivarci per non perdere i progressi fatti. Già, i progressi, legati per lo più agli oggetti che si possono creare. Tralasciamo che alcuni ingredienti sono veramente difficili da reperire, capita anche di trovare delle ricette per poterli realizzare ma farebbe piacere avere delle dritte sul sito (che al momento mi pare un pò scarno) dato che alcuni oggetti vanno creati andando a fare tentativi, per esempio ho salnitro, zolfo, polvere di carbone ma non ho ancora capito se si possa fare la polvere da sparo oppure come fabbricare dei pezzi di roccia per poter riparare alcuni oggetti.
Capisco le intenzioni degli sviluppatori ;"siccome temiamo che il gioco alla lunga venga a noia, cerchiamo di vivacizzarlo un pò", per i miei gusti è un pessimo escamotage, se un gioco è carino e godibile come sembrava non c'è bisogno di renderlo così frenetico, oppure dare la scelta ai giocatori il livello di difficoltà, dato che si rifà agli old games la soluzione ideale dato che molti giochi in passato permettevano questa scelta ai giocatori, sennò resta solo frenesia allo stato puro che fà solo venire voglia di buttare il pc dalla finestra, e a tal proposito mi viene in mente una battuta nel cartone di Gumball -"Ah, ecco perchè si chiamano portatili"

review:
This game is a lot of fun. :)

Deserves the "Labor of Love" award. This game is nurtured and cared for by the devs like a mother does their child. 

Features that I love about this game are:

+The ability to stun enemies, debuffs, realistic factors like hitting something with a club stuns it allowing me to run away. Really smart move, there.

+Clubs and rocks (though basic, you'd be surprised how many survival type games don't include man's most primitive weapons.

+Randomly generated biomes, like really random.

+Caves

+Tons  of loot, enemies, weapons, armors

+Feels like I'm fighting to survive and find food, not just being handed 50 chicken meats with no spoilage

Overall this game is one of my favorites. If they were to charge 14.99 tomorrow, I'd buy it instantly. 

Thank you so much devs, your game is better than any other game in it's class.

review:
I've been following this game since before it ran that [url=https://mynoise.net/NoiseMachines/whiteNoiseGenerator.php?l=99999999968571554330&m=&d=0]kickstarter[/url]. This game is actually really good once you get into it and can get some of the recipes into your book. It's finding / discovering the recipes that a lot of people have trouble with. It's also much more interesting with a friend, and the procedurally generated terrain makes it easy to come back to for a new game. 

That said, it can be unforgivingly difficult if you get large monsters near your spawn point. The difficulty seems to increase the farther away you get from the original spawn, but there's more interesting stuff to find out there. 

It's still Early Access, so it's not entirely polished, but it is much more polished than some of the other Early Access games I've seen out there, and with it changing to a Free to Play structure, I have no reason to not encourage people to play. 

Despite an unsuccessful kickstarter, the devs continue to update and create for this game, and I'm so happy to be along for the ride.

review:
Got this game for 5$ on Chrono.gg because it looked promising to me.

It was a bit hard to get into, especially since there are so few sources to help you but once you find your own rhythm when to gather stuff for survival, when to do more dangerous things etc. it's really fun. There's already quite a lot of content there.
Seeing how there hasn't been an update in a while, I really hope the devs are still working on this. 

Wouldn't say it's worth the full price in its current state, with it not being really polished yet, having a few bugs and potentially being dropped by the devs, but if the game looks interesting to you, I'd suggest putting it on your wishlist and following it, maybe getting it on sale some time. For the 5 bucks, it was totally worth it, would've paid 10 maybe, but then, I'm a cheap gamer, so you do you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083521083', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 7595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1678046224}
review:
A ver por donde empiezo, el juego es fantastico la banda sonora, los efectos al talar, picar sientes que lo estas haciendo tú. En las opciones del juego tienes autoclick, asi que no tienes que tener pegado el dedo al ratón en todo momento, tambien movimiento por click (botón derecho) y (w a s d). La interfaz es simple pero muy original y facil de aprender.

Cuenta con sistema día y noche, creacción y personalización del personaje.

Crafting: El sistema de crafteo es bastante bueno, con cuadro de busqueda,  tambien cuando aprendes la primera vez la receta ya puedes crearla si tener que volver a craftear los mismos materiales.

Combate: El combate es muy guay, claro al principico muy dificil con las armas de madera te tienes que ayudar de otros npcs que te ayuden a matar, yo aconsejo que al principio lo primero talar arboles y si son manzanos mejor. 

Te puedes morir por ataques o de hambre, ( de ahí talar manzanos) Las manzanas doradas son el futuro.

Tiene muchisimas recetas, muchisimos items, muchisimo drop, mercaderes, matar bichos te dara mucho gusto porque siempre te sueltan algo.

Mapa: El sistema de mapa es super original, va por zonas, por ejemplo en un cuadrado perfecto lo partes en nueve partes iguales, tu punto de aparición seria el centro, (cuando mueres apareces ahí, marcado con una S en el mapa) cuenta con minimapa, mapa completo y zoom. El mundo son 10000 cuadraditos. En el mapa se marcaran todos los puntos importantes como respawns y teleports.

Tiene teleport, en la pantalla se muestra donde esta la mesa de crafteo y demas objetos importantes que hayas puesto en el mundo mostrado con un bocadillo hacia la direccion que está.

Construcción: La casa es prediseñada y modificable, cuenta con paredes suelos y camas, de momento es lo que he podido descubrir (boton a la izq cuando estes dentro de la casa) parece que hay mas cosas desbloqueables que sera mas adelante.

Muerte: Cuando mueres, tu mochila aparecera en el mapa, cuando te estes acercando, en la pantalla te saldra el bocadillo hacia la dirección que está.
En la version testing, podras recuperar tus mochilas da igual las veces que hayas muerto.
El tiempo avanza con la muerte, no he calculado bien (he muerto 20 veces en 1 hora XD) pero creo que es como medio día, si mueres de noche apareces al amanecer. 
Vas a morir, no te estreses en Adventure craft no te regalan nada.

Cosas malas de adventure Craft :
-El juego no esta en Español. (porfavor español ya :)
-Nota 9/10
Os dejo una serie, de la nueva version testing, ahora podras obtener el juego totalmente GRATIS. Ya cuenta con ciudades de npcs y muchisimas cosas mas.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4cXiJfIbDOQ

review:
Das Spiel ist derzeit nicht spielbar, da es total unbalanced ist. Alle Gegner hauen einen mit ein paar Schlägen tot und die Materialien für die Rüstungen und Waffen sind so selten, dass man Stunden farmen muss, um überhaupt eines herstellen zu können. Die Haltbarkeit der Gegenstände ist viel zu gering und man ist mehr mit Reparieren beschäftigt als mit erkunden und sammeln. Und wenn man einmal stirb (was extrem häufig passiert) ist es unmöglich auch nur ansatzweise an seine Gegenstände zurück zu kommen, da man danach zu schnell wieder stirbt. 
Derzeit kann ich das Spiel in seinem derzeitigen Format nicht empfehlen. Potenzial hätte es.

Coś jakby zmieszać Hero Siege i Don't Starve. W pikselowy sposób staramy się przeżyć każdy dzień, w nocy walcząć z demonami, budując swoje domki, fortyfikacje i powoli przebijając się dalej w świecie pełnym frakcji, różnych monstrów, pokojowych i wrogich. Bardzo fajny system craftringu, gdzie jeden item można nawet na 4 sposoby rozłożyć, zmienić lub ulepszyć. Problemem tej produkcji jest kompletny brak samouczka. Gra z cyklu "masz naucz się sam podchodząc 10x". Ciekawie wypada system klonów, naszych własnych NPC, którzy będą mogli walczyć i wykonywać polecenia za nas. Bardzo dużo itemów - kilkaset przynajmniej. Od dzidy, po broń palną, spora ilość itemów do jedzenia, potworów. Ogólny content gry jest zadziwiająco spory, jednak niestety zbyt źle "wprowadzony", przez co gracz przez godziny może nie mieć wiedzy o tym, że ma rozwiązanie swojego problemu pod nosem.

review:
マイクラやテラリアをやっていれば、英語が分からなくても結構大丈夫かと思います。いつか日本語modが出来ればより人気が出そうです。キャラクターカスタマイズの種類も多いですし、色変えも多いので好きな自分のキャラクターを作れるのがとても良いと思います。一人プレイですが、仲間も時々増えてくれるのでボッチプレイでの寂しさは無い気がします。仲間キャラの外見は最初はランダムなので、何が出てくるか楽しみもありますね。ゲームを進めると自分で仲間の外見を変える事が出来るようになるかも？気持ち夜になるのが早いので、敵よけに焚火を早めに作った方が良いですかね。家が出来ればプレイも安定するかと思います。

追記：敵が基本強いので、死んだあと荷物を取りに良く途中ですぐ死んでしまいロストします。そしてまた素材集めてロストのループに陥ってしまい、全く先に進みません。ワープゾーンが量産出来れば良いのですが、素材が集まらないです。そもそも体につける装備の素材が木や石ではなく敵からの素材なので敵を倒さないといけないのですが、敵がまぁ強いｗそのため常に裸縛りです。もう少し装備の敷居が低くなれば良いのですが。今度街も出来るみたいなので、街が出来たら多少楽になるでしょうか。

review:
Want to give a big thanks to the Devs for giving me access to this game early and giving me the opportunity to check it out.  Here are my thoughts of the game so far. 

Overall i would give this game about an 8/10 for overall content and style. The playstyle is very fluid and addicting and the content is nearly endless. Devs did an amazing job with this game with the amount of things you can do, but i would have liked the difficulty to be a little easier at the start because its very hard early on without your house to keep you alive at night. Also along those same lines i would like the night and day cycle to be longer, or give more emphisis to the day time so that you have time to do things during the day. 

The art style takes me back to zelda only the movement of everything gives me a more satisfying grind.

Overall I would recomend this game to anyone who enjoys a good survival overhead and doesnt mind dying 30 times in the begining.

review:
This is one of the most well thought-out early release games I have had the honor of playing so far. I was lucky enough to receive this game in a give away on FirstGen_Gamer's twitch livestream. Since then I have just been playing and playing and playing.

It's addicting. No seriously I need those wooden stakes... don't stop me now...

The old school feel of the graphics really takes me back to my childhood, exploring the realms of 8 and 16 bit top down worlds like Zelda; but the massive amount of stuff going on at any one time, from the resource gathering to the running for your life from hordes of death dogs brings me to more modern games like Terraria. It's a pleasing mix of old and new that I feel the gaming society really needed.

I've created the Adventure Craft unofficial wiki recently and plan to add more to it as I play. I really hope it helps new players enjoy this game as much as I have. Adventure on my friends!

review:
About a year ago I stumbled upon the alpha demo for this game and did a playthrough for my youtube channel. I absolutely loved this game and had a blast making a series of videos on it. One of the developers found my videos and we had several very pleasant exchanges. He was also very appreciative and supportive of the videos I made. Seriously an awesome guy.

About a year passed and I didn't see much in regard to development news and I was worried that something happened and the game wasn't progressing any further in development. My worries were put at ease when I heard the news that Adventure Craft was launching on steam early access! I was also contacted by the developer and gifted a copy of the Early Access Build and I must say, they have been busy! So much has been added since the Alpha Demo that I played!

There is so much to explore in the proceedurally generated world of Adventure Craft and you never know what you will come across. From random EPIC battles between hordes of zombies and friendly NPCs to nightmarish creatures invading through portals or even the ever-present goblin villages, there isn't a dull minute. You're either hunting and gathering for precious materials to use for crafting, looting all sorts of goodness or running (or fighting) for you life! 

Here are some of my observations:

* TONS of different recipes to discover/craft

* Seemingly endless surprises to encounter. Some nights are quiet, some nights all hell breaks loose through portals from who knows where and other nights hordes of zombies swarm the world around you.

* A wide variety of monsters and NPCs

* A crazy looking night carnival that randomly appeared with chests that cost tickets to open and a giant rainbow boar pinata :D

* A cave system full of traps and loot

* Dungeons (Dungeon entrances exist but cannot yet be entered. You are prompted with a message stating they will be added soon. I can't wait to check them out)

* A puppy that helps gather and fight! And he grows up (I just found this out today lol)

* Build houses, teleporters, customize your house, craft A TON of different tools, foods, armor, and more
 
* Build a device that makes clones that, from my understanding, can assist you in your adventures (I haven't gotten all the materials for this recipe just yet).

* Absolutely insane random battles breaking out between monsters and NPC villager types.

* References to various movies and other video games (I love it).

Adventure Craft truly has captivated me. Edible Entertainment has successfully harnessed various aspects of so many classics, added their own style and mechanics and managed to bring a cute (and sometimes terrifying), captivating and very much enjoyable experience. I cannot wait to see what else awaits me in game and what the developers continue to add and it will certainly have a home on my twitch stream.

If you enjoy crafting/survival/rpg style games I would highly recommend Adventure Craft!

review:
So far, I've been enjoying it for the ammount of hours I've been playing it. It's pretty addicting for me since i tried the demo. I haven't really picked up any survival-type games like this before so getting my hands on the demo actually surprised me with how addicting it was. I ended up playing it for almost a week and a half straight just waiting for the game's release. It runs nicely on my cheap-ish gaming pc, the difficulty/learning curve is alright. I like the idea with the way the game handles you dying a lot. The game it's self is... It's... kind of like The Legend of Zelda meets Don't Starve. And if you like The Legend of Zelda & Don't Starve, it's worth giving it a try.

Edit: Please do keep in mind, the game is EXTREMELY unforgiving. If you die twice before you can get your stuff back, you lose everything you had on you.
